body_html:
My hope is when tf.estimator has clean multi-gpu performance we can migrate the group that uses tf.slim to that, which will be soon. The performance alone will be worth it and it would be silly for them to not use a framework with much higher performance. I cannot push them until TF.estimator is ready. I also cannot force them but I will strongly encourage them at that point. We all know each other so this is not a hostile situation just change management.
…
On Mon, Mar 12, 2018, 2:19 PM bhack ***@***.***> wrote: @tfboyd <https://github.com/tfboyd> Nice to know but the problem is that super blending edge/fresh solutions <https://github.com/tensorflow/models/tree/master/research/deeplab> are still contributed with SLIM from the "internal" flow pipeline. It is hard to know when this projects was started so I don't know what is your internal policy now. I mentioned this basically related to my previous comment on tensorflow/models#1357 (comment) <tensorflow/models#1357 (comment)> — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#16182 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AWZesiKrXKBRHgb_CYyjgqdgIKRojyIYks5tduZtgaJpZM4Rg7x2> .

body:
My hope is when tf.estimator has clean multi-gpu performance we can migrate
the group that uses tf.slim to that, which will be soon.  The performance
alone will be worth it and it would be silly for them to not use a
framework with much higher performance.  I cannot push them until
TF.estimator is ready.  I also cannot force them but I will strongly
encourage them at that point.  We all know each other so this is not a
hostile situation just change management.

On Mon, Mar 12, 2018, 2:19 PM bhack <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @tfboyd <https://github.com/tfboyd> Nice to know but the problem is that super
> blending edge/fresh solutions
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/models/tree/master/research/deeplab> are
> still contributed with SLIM from the "internal" flow pipeline.
> It is hard to know when this projects was started so I don't know what is
> your internal policy now.
> I mentioned this basically related to my previous comment on tensorflow/models#1357
> (comment)
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/models/issues/1357#issuecomment-347722179>
>
> —
